intro: Lycium cedrosense, commonly known as Cedros nightshade, is a flowering plant native to the island of Cedros in the Gulf of California. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes tomatoes, potatoes, and peppers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the evening. Its berries are orange-red and contain toxic alkaloids, making them harmful to humans and animals. Lycium cedrosense is adapted to arid environments and is often found in coastal scrub habitats.
